intro: Acetosella leptocalyx, commonly known as the slender-stalked sorrel, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, erect stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grassy areas or along stream banks. Acetosella leptocalyx is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in native plant gardens.
